column2:
Family Barony Events refers to the mini event chain in which a family member who is in your court asks you to pay a bishop/mayor vassal so that the family member can take over as bishop/mayor.

These events (enabled by default in Elder Kings) can be intrusive, and it's quite possible you ALWAYS want to choose "no".

At the moment, these events are §GENABLED§!.

This decision allows you to permanently suppress these events, for your current character and all successors, unless/until you take the decision re-enabling them.
Family Barony Events will be §Rpermanently disabled§!, for yourself and all of your successors

Family Barony Events refers to the mini event chain in which a family member who is in your court asks you to pay a bishop/mayor vassal so that the family member can take over as bishop/mayor.

These events (enabled by default in Elder Kings) can be intrusive, and it's quite possible you ALWAYS want to choose "no".

At the moment, these events are §RDISABLED§!.

This decision allows you to re-enable them.
Family Barony Events will be §Genabled§!, for yourself and all of your successors

Family Barony Events refers to the mini event chain in which a family member who is in your court asks you to pay a bishop/mayor vassal so that the family member can take over as bishop/mayor.

These events (enabled by default in Elder Kings) can be intrusive, and it's quite possible you ALWAYS want to choose "no".

The presence of this modifier on a character means that these events are §RDISABLED§! for that character.
